headline: Nvidia, Dell, and Apple Rally. Tech Goods Has Shifted Assembly.
summary: Shares of tech goods makers rose off their morning lows on news of the high court’s ruling.  Apple, for example, had spent years beefing up its iPhone manufacturing capacity in India, and was able to shift that output to the U.S. In its first quarter, Apple’s products gross profit margin increased by 1.4 percentage points from the year before, despite the tariff headwind.  Apple stock rose 0.6% in midday trading, after being down as much as 0.9%.

Apple stock rose 0.6% in midday trading, after being down as much as 0.9%.

headline: OpenAI Signals Chip Supply Visibility Amid Growing AI Demand
summary: This article first appeared on GuruFocus.  OpenAI executives are signaling measured confidence on chip supply even as artificial intelligence demand continues to strain the broader semiconductor ecosystem. headline: Nvidia close to investing $30 billion in OpenAI's funding round: source
summary: STORY: Nvidia is reportedly close to finalizing a $30 billion investment in OpenAI.As the chipmaker moves to take a stake in one of its largest customers.That's according to a source speaking to Reuters.They said the investment is part of a fundraising round in which OpenAI is seeking more than $100 billion.It would value the ChatGPT maker at about $830 billion and amount to one of the largest private capital raises on record.Reuters previously reported that SoftBank Group and Amazon are also likely to take part in the round.The investment would show growing links among major technology companies as they race to build advanced AI systems.It's led to chip suppliers, cloud providers and model developers deepening financial and strategic ties.Nvidia declined to comment when contacted by Reuters.The person said OpenAI is set to use much of the fresh capital to purchase Nvidia's chips.They power the training and deployment of its AI models.The Financial Times reported Nvidia's new investment would replace a commitment it announced in September.It had previously said it would invest up to $100 billion to support OpenAI's use of its chips in data centers.

raw.headline: Nvidia close to investing $30 billion in OpenAI's funding round: source
raw.summary: STORY: Nvidia is reportedly close to finalizing a $30 billion investment in OpenAI.As the chipmaker moves to take a stake in one of its largest customers.That's according to a source speaking to Reuters.They said the investment is part of a fundraising round in which OpenAI is seeking more than $100 billion.It would value the ChatGPT maker at about $830 billion and amount to one of the largest private capital raises on record.Reuters previously reported that SoftBank Group and Amazon are also likely to take part in the round.The investment would show growing links among major technology companies as they race to build advanced AI systems.It's led to chip suppliers, cloud providers and model developers deepening financial and strategic ties.Nvidia declined to comment when contacted by Reuters.The person said OpenAI is set to use much of the fresh capital to purchase Nvidia's chips.They power the training and deployment of its AI models.The Financial Times reported Nvidia's new investment would replace a commitment it announced in September.It had previously said it would invest up to $100 billion to support OpenAI's use of its chips in data centers.

headline: Nvidia, OpenAI near $30 billion investment in place of unfinished $100 billion deal, FT reports
summary: Nvidia is close to finalizing a $30 billion investment ‌into OpenAI that will replace ‌the long-term $100 billion commitment agreed upon by the ​companies last year, the Financial Times reported on Thursday, citing sources.  The deal, which would be part of ‌a new ⁠funding round for the artificial intelligence start-up, could be ⁠finalized as early as this weekend, the report added.  Reuters could ​not immediately ​verify the ​report.
